title: go build xxx: /usr/lib/golang/pkg/tool/linux_386/compile: signal: trace/breakpoint trap
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue. Thanks!

1. What version of Go are you using (`go version`)?
go version go1.5.1 linux/386

2. What operating system and processor architecture are you using (`go env`)?
GOARCH="386"
GOBIN=""
GOEXE=""
GOHOSTARCH="386"
GOHOSTOS="linux"
GOOS="linux"
GOPATH="/root/go"
GORACE=""
GOROOT="/usr/lib/golang"
GOTOOLDIR="/usr/lib/golang/pkg/tool/linux_386"
GO15VENDOREXPERIMENT=""
CC="gcc"
GOGCCFLAGS="-fPIC -m32 -pthread -fmessage-length=0"
CXX="g++"
CGO_ENABLED="1"

3. What did you do?
If possible, provide a recipe for reproducing the error.
A complete runnable program is good.
A link on play.golang.org is best.

  I install new OS, install golang and build, failed.

4. What did you expect to see?
build successfully.

5. What did you see instead?
No matter what I build, I get:
go build xxx: /usr/lib/golang/pkg/tool/linux_386/compile: signal: trace/breakpoint trap

CentOS 6.
